Conteudo: Brasília - In light of inflation prospects for the targets path, the Copom unanimously decided to lower the Selic rate to 8.75 percent, without bias. Considering that the monetary policy easing implemented since January has lagged and cumulative effects over economy, the Committee evaluates, at the moment, that this basic interest rate level is consistent with a benign inflationary scenario, contributing to ensure the convergence of inflation to the targets path during the relevant forecast period, as well as to the non-inflationary recovery of economic activity.
